title: Object Oriented Python
overview: Learn the fundamentals of object-oriented programming (OOP) in Python, including classes, objects, constructors, and methods. OOP helps organize code, model real-world entities, and promotes code reuse.
examples:
d = Dog('Buddy')
d.bark()  # Output: Buddy says Woof!
practice: Create a Car class with brand and year.
Add a method that prints car details.
Create 3 objects using the class and call their methods.
Create a BankAccount class with deposit and withdraw methods.
Create a class hierarchy with a parent class Vehicle and child classes Car and Bike.

quiz.question: Which keyword is used to define a class in Python?
How do you call a method of an object?

summary: Object-oriented programming in Python allows you to create classes and objects to model real-world entities. Using constructors, methods, and variables, you can encapsulate data and behavior, making your code organized, reusable, and easier to maintain.
